Sentencas: The polarization processes occurring at the electrode electrolyte interfaces of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) were investigated by electrochemical impedance spectra measured at single cells under realistic operating conditions.
Titulo: Deconvolution of electrochemical impedance spectra for the identification of electrode reaction mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The approach presented is based on distributions of relaxation times which are the basic quantity of interest in electrochemical impedance data analysis.
Titulo: Deconvolution of electrochemical impedance spectra for the identification of electrode reaction mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A deconvolution method was developed and implemented that yields these characteristic distribution patterns directly from the impedance spectra.
Titulo: Deconvolution of electrochemical impedance spectra for the identification of electrode reaction mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In contrast to nonlinear least squares curve fit of equivalent circuit models, no a priori circuit choice has to be made.
Titulo: Deconvolution of electrochemical impedance spectra for the identification of electrode reaction mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Even more importantly, the excellent resolving capacity allows the untangling of the impedance contributions of up to three physically distinct processes within one frequency decade.
Titulo: Deconvolution of electrochemical impedance spectra for the identification of electrode reaction mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: With the method, processes with the highest polarization losses can be identified and targeted to improve cell performance.
Titulo: Deconvolution of electrochemical impedance spectra for the identification of electrode reaction mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Based on the distributions, a general strategy for the identification of the reaction mechanisms is given.
Titulo: Deconvolution of electrochemical impedance spectra for the identification of electrode reaction mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The evaluation of the distributions in terms of peak parameters is illustrated by a physical model for oxygen reduction at the SOFC cathode electrolyte interface.
Titulo: Deconvolution of electrochemical impedance spectra for the identification of electrode reaction mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The method is expected to find many applications in electrochemistry beyond the field of solid oxide fuel cell development.
Titulo: Deconvolution of electrochemical impedance spectra for the identification of electrode reaction mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cells
